item.description:
It's been a while since we tried this...a reading, or as I call it, a literary gift-giving. Let us each bring something we love and would like to share with the group: a poem, a tale, an excerpt from a play or a novel, anything literary. The possibilities are endless... Amuse and surprise us, by all means. You will have up to five minutes to contribute. You may chose to participate or to simply listen. If possible, let us know in advance what you are planning to bring, and if you can, bring copies of the piece to share with the group (it makes it easier to follow).

And remember this...

“Every reader finds oneself. The writer's work is merely a kind of optical instrument that makes it possible for the reader to discern what, without this book, she would perhaps never have seen in herself.” 

- Marcel Proust

group.name: Classic Books: Book Club for Die-hard Readers

item.name: A literary reading
